statuseffect

Class StatusEffect

  • java.lang.Object
    • statuseffect.StatusEffect
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cripple, Detonate, Normal, Poison, Shatter, Stun, Weaken

    public abstract class StatusEffect
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for applying an effect to enemies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StatusEffect(int duration)
      StatusEffects are an effect that can happen to enemies on either initialization or on a set interval of frames for the entire duration it is applied.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      void giveEffect(Hostile hostile)
      Used for giving an effect to hostiles.
      boolean isActive() 
      static void loadImages() 
      boolean onEnemy() 
      void update()
      Called every frame if applied to a hostile reduces duration timer and applies the effect (if applicable) each frame

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • StatusEffect

        public StatusEffect(int duration)
        StatusEffects are an effect that can happen to enemies on either initialization or on a set interval of frames for the entire duration it is applied.

        public void giveEffect(Hostile hostile)
        Used for giving an effect to hostiles. This will give the hostile field a value, along with activating the effect and initializing the subclass.
        Parameters:
        hostile -
